intro: Hofmeisteria pubescens, commonly known as the hairy hofmeisteria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Hofmeisteria pubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
